subject: Re: [junit] Testing Static class behavior
msgSnippet: I believe the whole point was exactly the opposite. Make the constructor public but refere to the Factory for people needing advances multi-threaded behaviors.
messageBody:
I believe the whole point was exactly the opposite.
Make the constructor public but refere to the Factory
for people needing advances multi-threaded behaviors.
 
One can still access the constructor but for simple behaviors.
 
Did I missed smthg or what ?
 
Tx,
 
Thomas,

      I would keep the constructor private and make a Factory method that
says it all:

      static ConcernedType createInstanceForUnitTestsOnly(...){   ...      }

      if you have your TestCase in the same package, you still hide it for
the rest of the packages.

      And a lazy initializer:

      public static ConcernedType getInstance(){ ... }
